data.title: (export) vars is corrupt!
data.body:
export (TYPE) var NAME_VAR does not work correctly. At the time of construction of the object, all fields that were installed with the help of the inspector, in the editor window during the boot sequence of the scene (at a time when executed, the function _ ready ()), are absolutely empty, even if the original scene takes the field set in the inspector, in advance, before the creation of any instance of such a scene.
And if, in the script, previously obvious way to set default values, they will be in place initially, but when the editor creates a new instance of the scene and in the Inspector, change the field (export), for some other value, and save the scene, then when run scene, the new value will never appear, instead will always be something that was previously specified in the script in obvious way ...

data.title: improve Node.get_filename ()
data.body:
_ready ():
SELF_RES_SCENE = get_filename ()

SELF_RES_SCENE will be empty, but if get_filename () call in the running process, it works well.

data.title: Popup scaling issue with custom editor font size
data.body:
When I set the editor font to unicode 14pt Noto Sans, I found one instance where I can't press the create or cancel buttons on the "create script" dialog due to overlapping UI (text) elements interfering with buttons (see the attached for comparison between normal & user-specified font). Other than this case, I've not found an issue with using a larger font (except a trivial issue with About dialog text overflowing to beyond the dialog box dimension). I will try using a smaller font size...so this is JFYI for the future.. 

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11791450/7608034/9840d0cc-f9a9-11e4-8e40-9a0ebf47a1eb.png)

About dialog (when using 14pt font - JFYI only)
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11791450/7608141/324d6950-f9aa-11e4-9ca8-7f151fc95484.png)

data.title: RigidBody2D sleeping inspector bools ignored
data.body:
RigidBody2D is ignoring "sleeping" and "can sleep" bools in the inspector.

If "sleeping" is set to true and "can sleep" to false if I print is_sleeping() and is_able_to_sleep() in _ready() it prints true and false as expected.  But if printed in _process() they print false and true, opposite to what was expected, as if they are returning to default values when the game runs.

data.title: Int to Boolean error ln 57, 82
data.body: 1.1rc2 does not read 0 as 'false'

data.title: new version does not overwrite editor_settings
data.body:
Each new version of godot will have its own editor_settings.xml file.

Advantages :
- customized script editor colors won't be lost at each new version
- allow users to manage different projects with different versions of 
  godot (each version has its own project list)
- make comparing different version of godot to track bugs easier

data.title: Signals are not duplicated with their parent node when created from editor UI
data.body:
_Bugsquad edit:_ Initially seen in 1.1 rc2 and still exists in 2.0 alpha  b2f9acb8c96aed0505cbac21661e21e4acef710f commit

**Update2 (20.01.2016)**
One more time, a better test project to test the issue: [DuplicateTests.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/97359/DuplicateTests.zip)

**Update:**
New sample project that replicate this issue in more straightforward way:
https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/168251/godot/bugsquad/NotDuplicatedSignalIssue.7z
Also small video that shows how issue has been replicated in this sample (for quick judge):
https://youtu.be/_fYBUKBWzrA

**Old** (not so relevant currently) content:
It seems that VisibilityEnabler/Notifer is not working if it's on a scene that has been duplicated with .duplicate() method. Below is a link to sample project that illustrates the problem.
https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/168251/godot/some/issues/DuplicateIssue.7z

data.title: 2D pathfinding collision avoidance (with walls and obstacles)
data.body:
It would be nice to have some collision avoidance for a moving unit on a navigation polygon, so it won't collide with edges that it has to pass by or obstacles that stand in its paths way.
For avoiding collision with the edges of the nav-polygon, it would be nice if the engine would apply some invert offset to the navigation polygon to shrink it down accordingly to the X * Y shape of the current unit. For a reference on how the polygon should be shrinked, here is a link:
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/1109536/an-algorithm-for-inflating-deflating-offsetting-buffering-polygons
This would allow perfect movement of units that have different dimensions (X * Y) without colliding at walls/edges. Also, if the polygon gets shrunk, paths that are too small to pass would be automatically collapsed and removed from consideration.

Avoidance of collision with other units / objects that are currently standing still or collide with the moving unit would be nice to have too. An idea would be to check the current path segment the unit is moving at, if this segment is intersecting with an idling unit/object and if so, find an alternative path for this segment.
Some considerations and further readings about this collision avoidance with other units can be found in this link under the "Notes on implementation" section at "1. Other Units (collision avoidance)" subsection: http://www.policyalmanac.org/games/aStarTutorial.htm

Sadly I'm too noob to directly help with code I guess, but I would still like to help as much as I can with testing or anything else if this gets implemented.
Thanks in advance!

data.body:

data.title: get_local_mouse_pos() offset bug in the editor
data.body:
I try to write a small editor plugin with gdscript. In my script I need the mouse coordinates in 2d world space. There for I use CanvasItem.get_local_mouse_pos() which in general seems to work fine, but there is an offset which I think may be a bug.

Take a look at the screen attached. When I position my mouse at 0,0 the printed position is about 12,98. Which seems to be the exact dimensions of the upper left rect I illustrated.
This offset is set by a zoom of 100%. Whenn I zoom in, the offset gets smaller and when I zoom out the offset gets bigger!

![local_mouse_pos_bug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6723918/7580546/6228c766-f877-11e4-9f27-f755efc457cd.jpg)

(right)1->(right)2->(right)3->(right)4->(left) 0

data.title: Problem with GDScript line breaking
data.body:
From https://github.com/okamstudio/godot/issues/208, it seems that line breaks in parenthesis should be valid GDScript.  However, the parser does not think so:

![newline_error](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/244322/7557625/b5033552-f75a-11e4-8619-25464a5d7ad5.png)

If this is intended to be valid syntax, the parser has an error.

data.title: Support for fixed process on timer (Idle/Fixed mode) and a small change for more uniform ticks
data.body:
- **Implemented support for fixed process on timer** 
  This is useful for cooldowns without the influence from framerate.
  The implementation is similar to animation player (idle/fixed mode), where idle mode = old timer, fixed mode = fixed process implementation:
  Example of the new behaviour with a stream of bullets with timers for each shoot on different frame rates:
  https://gfycat.com/HeartyImpressiveIndiancow
- **A change for more uniform ticks on fixed/idle**
  without this fix:
  ![0tmq6cg 1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12376042/7554392/415ed4b8-f6f5-11e4-8acd-3af7582cc381.png)
  with this fix:
  ![3zyx16c 1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12376042/7554393/4ac3f7cc-f6f5-11e4-902d-6625b34e9355.png)

The change is:

> ```
>       time_left -= get_process_delta_time();
>         if (time_left<0) {
>             if (!one_shot)
>                 time_left=wait_time+time_left; //this line changed for: time_left = wait_time;
>             else
>                 stop();
>             emit_signal("timeout");
>         }
> ```

The reason for the change is:
With _time_left=wait_time+time_left;_ method: the algorithm takes on account the remaining ms from last tick for the next one, so not all ticks are the same
With _time_left = wait_time;_ method: the algorithm discards the remaining ms, so all the ticks are the same

Example of the old behaviour with a timer of 0.04 ms on a fixed framerate of 60 (~0,016 ms):

> 0,0
> 0,016
> 0,032
> 0,048
> ----- TICK on 4 frames
> 0,008
> 0,024
> 0,040
> ----- TICK on 3 frames
> 0,0
> 0,016
> 0,032
> 0,048
> ----- TICK on 4 frames

So every second tick is more fastest, resulting on non uniform behaviour between all ticks, On the fix, all the ticks start with the same value, so is always the same result (4 frames)

data.title: Remove focus from restart button, fixes #1850
data.body: Fixes a problem where the restart button would keep focus after being pressed, making the tetris' pieces impossible to rotate without activating the button again.

data.title: HDR is not working correctly with vsync off
data.body:
I'm trying out the HDR demo and it is not working correctly. It seems to update really slow in a "frame-by-frame" basis. However the project is running at good fps (I can move the cave around smoothly).
If I move around the game window, it seems to update the HDR to the state at which it should be.
The HDR effect works correctly while in the editor.

Also, the hdr tutorial (https://github.com/okamstudio/godot/wiki/tutorial_hdr), in the "Parameters of HDR" section, says that the Environment resource should have the Hdr parameters, however they don't appear in my editor.

I uploaded a video showing these things to clarify:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3YW8WqQEleE

My system specs:
Windows 8.1 64bit, dual screen
CPU: AMD FX-8320 8-core @ 3.5Ghz
GPU: AMD HD6850
RAM: 8GB

data.title: 1.1rc2 crashes on Windows with -h option
data.body: Running godot_win64-1.1rc2.exe -h  crashes after displaying the help text.

data.title: DirAccess fails on make_dir and dir_exists with user://
data.body:
I added a comment to issue #791 but could not reopen the issue because I did not originally create it.  The comment I added is repeated below but see the original issue for the test driver and patch that was working for 1.0 stable.  The test driver can be run with godot -s test_driver.gd.

I just tried my test driver with 1.1rc2 and it fails on line 10, the dir.make_dir() line, with ERR_CANT_CREATE. Manually creating the directory and commenting that line out, it fails on line 11 doing the dir_exists() check.

I did not look closely at the changes made in 1.1rc2 but I know with the patches I have above this test driver runs all the way through with 1.0 stable + my patch.

data.title: SOLVED: Lock up when running project in 1.1rc2 (and rc3)
data.body:
Trying to run my project in godot1.1rc2 but it isn't working

I can load the project just fine, but when I go to run the scene, it locks up on the loading screen. Nothing is printed in the output box aside from *\* Debug Mode Started *\* and *\* Debug Mode Stopped **. I have that white screen with the Godot logo, which windows tells me is "Not responding." However, the console is still showing me some print() commands that should be showing up from my _ready() scripts, but not ones from my _process(delta) scripts. The same project runs fine from godot1.0stable.

If I leave it running, every once in a while the console will give me a
md5: [big string of characters]
vs: [another big string of characters]
checking: c/[...]/skeleton.png

A couple times a line popped up that said "lloosstt??"
or sometimes just "lost?"

It is possible I asked it to print that (I know I started to code a function somewhere to check if a battle was lost, and might have had it print that as a placeholder), but if so, I couldn't find a line in my script anywhere with those particular strings of characters in any of the obvious places.  So thinking it might be triggered by something in the engine?

skeleton.png is a spritesheet for a placeholder character. It appears to be loading just fine in the editor. I'm not seeing any error messages in the console, so I have no idea what the problem is. Exception being: the first time I loaded the project in rc2 I got some messages about a custom interface theme not loading, but haven't seen that error since.

I don't have this problem with the 2D platform jumper demo, so it clearly has something to do with the particular project I am working on, and not just any project that was made with an older build of godot. 

is this an engine bug?  If not, pointers on where to trouble shoot on my end?
